com.jalapeno
Interface Utilities

public interface Utilities

Provides interface to perfrom some additional operations on POJOs such as serialize objects to XML and deserialize them back.

Method Summary

Method Detail

serializeToXML

java.lang.String serializeToXML(java.lang.Object pojo,
                                java.lang.String charset,
                                java.lang.String namespace)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Creates an XML representation of a given object as a String. The object must be XML serializable.

Note Call to this method may cause changes to the object to be saved in the database.

Parameters:
pojo - Object to serialize.
charset - Charset to use. Value null means default charset.
namespace - Namespace to use. Value null means default namespace.
Returns:
An XML representation of a given object as a String.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
addToXMLDocument(Object, Object)

serializeToXML

java.lang.String serializeToXML(java.lang.Object pojo)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Creates an XML representation of a given object as a String using default charset and namespace. The object must be XML serializable.

Note Call to this method may cause changes to the object to be saved in the database.

Parameters:
pojo - Object to serialize.
Returns:
An XML representation of a given object as a String.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

startXMLDocument

java.lang.Object startXMLDocument(java.lang.String rootTag,
                                  java.lang.String charset,
                                  java.lang.String namespace)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Start creating XML document that will contain serialized representation of objects. This method creates an instance of XML document. Method addToXMLDocument should be used then to serialize objects int this document. Method closeXMLDocument should be used to obtain a String representation of the XML created in this document.

Parameters:
rootTag - Root tag of XML document.
charset - Charset to use. Value null means default charset.
namespace - Namespace to use. Value null means default namespace.
Returns:
Instance of XML document.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
addToXMLDocument(Object, Object), closeXMLDocument(Object)

addToXMLDocument

void addToXMLDocument(java.lang.Object xmlDocument,
                      java.lang.Object pojo)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Adds XML representation of a given object to given XML document. The object must be XML serializable. The XML document must be previously created by startXMLDocument method.

Note Call to this method may cause changes to the object to be saved in the database.

Parameters:
pojo - Object to serialize.
xmlDocument - XML document to which the XML representation is added.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
serializeToXML(Object, String, String), serializeToXML(Object), startXMLDocument(String, String, String)

closeXMLDocument

java.lang.String closeXMLDocument(java.lang.Object xmlDocument)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Closes XML document and produces a String representation of XML.

Parameters:
xmlDocument - XML document to close.
Returns:
String representation of the XML.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
startXMLDocument(String, String, String), addToXMLDocument(Object, Object)

readFromXML

java.lang.Object readFromXML(java.lang.Class aClass,
                             java.lang.String xml)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Deserializes XML and creates an object in the database. Class must support XML serialization.

Newly created object is not guranteed to be saved in the database.

Parameters:
aClass - A class instance of which to create.
xml - XML to deserialize.
Returns:
Deserialized instance of class aClass.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

schemaStatus

java.util.Map schemaStatus(java.util.Collection javaClassNames)
Checks whether database schema for gievn classes exists in the database.

Parameters:
javaClassNames - Collection of Java class names represented as java.lang.String.
Returns:
Map where the keySet() is formed from the collection passed to a method and value for each key is:
  • null Class does not have schema in the database.
  • 0 (integer) Class has up-to-date schema in the database.
  • negative integer Class has schema in the database but it may be not up-to-date
  • positive integer Class has Schema in the database and it may have been modified manulally on the database side.

getMemoryCacheSize

int getMemoryCacheSize(int mode)
Returns the number of objects in memory cache.

Parameters:
mode - Can be 1 or 2. If value is 1 then it returns the number of POJO objects. If the value is 2 it returns the number of proxy objects. When strong cache is used both numbers should be the same. They can differ in case of weak cache.
Returns:
the number of objects in memory cache.
